newsitem.title: NICARAGUA: Jimmy Carter to observe Nicaragua election.
newsitem.headline: Jimmy Carter to observe Nicaragua election.

text.p: Former U.S. President Jimmy Carter will be an observer at Nicaragua's Oct. 20 elections, a Carter Centre official said on Thursday.

Carter will arrive in Nicaragua on Oct. 18 for a five-day visit accompanied by former U.S. Secretary of State James Baker, the head of the Carter Centre observer mission in Nicaragua, Jennifer McCoy, said.
"He's coming to observe the elections and promote a peaceful transfer of power in Nicaragua," McCoy said.
The elections will mark the first transfer of power from one elected, civilian government to another in Nicaragua.
